title: Hunala
description: Introducing Hunala—the COVID risk-assessment app powered by Yale University. The app uses cutting-edge network science and machine learning to keep you informed and able to make safe decisions. Our simple daily check-ins create a personalized risk assessment so you can manage your exposure to COVID-19, even as variants and vaccines change the pandemic landscape.
descriptionHTML: Introducing Hunala—the COVID risk-assessment app powered by Yale University. The app uses cutting-edge network science and machine learning to keep you informed and able to make safe decisions. Our simple daily check-ins create a personalized risk assessment so you can manage your exposure to COVID-19, even as variants and vaccines change the pandemic landscape.
recentChanges:
A new-and-improved app interface makes it easier to access your personalized Risk Report. The Risk Report now provides more detailed risk data. The daily survey has been updated as well, to account for variants and vaccination rates.

Understand your personal risk of exposure as variants and vaccines affect the pandemic
recentChangesHTML:
A new-and-improved app interface makes it easier to access your personalized Risk Report. The Risk Report now provides more detailed risk data. The daily survey has been updated as well, to account for variants and vaccination rates.

Understand your personal risk of exposure as variants and vaccines affect the pandemic
comments: Sorry, a fail out of the gate: I enter my phone; they send a text; I switch to my SMS app to get the code; I switch back to Hunala. It restarts the app and asks for my phone Basic Android event-flow

I love the concept. But I am traveling across the U.S. and the app "find my location" tool never works. Yes, my phone GPS is on. Yes, all permissions have been granted. I travel for a living and I know how to use this stuff. I am having no problems with local search, routing, weather and all the other apps that use my phone's GPS location. Just this one. There is something wrong with this app. It is of no use to me if it isn't tracking the many states I'm traveling thru each day.

I had high hopes for this app. But the questions are few and don't allow nuance, and the results seem to vary wildly for no reason. I tried to provide feedback, but wasn't answered elsewhere, and in app does not allow questions/help/etc. Very disappointed and feel used

Good idea, but after asking for my contacts, it tells me there is no information available in my area. There are globally available data sources, so that shouldn't be an issue. And you shouldn't need access to my contacts' information. If you know where I am, how many estimated cases there are, the size of the population and how many people I have contact with, you can show me a number representing my risk, and a note about the confidence level of that information.
Very cool idea, but when I enter my phone number (doube and triple checked), no code is sent and I'm left without access to the app
Simple disease tracking app. Works better with friends.
Needs more content. Great app though.
Why does personal risk max out of I say I've stayed home for non-illness reasons (eg, working from home to mitigate sars2 spread)?
Appreciate that it Asks for the bare minimum
Way too much personal info asked.
